intro: Phlomis kopetdaghensis, commonly known as Kopetdagh blazing star, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its tall, erect stems and clusters of purple or pink flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are typically gray-green and covered in fine hairs, adapted to reduce water loss in its harsh environment. Phlomis kopetdaghensis is often found in rocky soils and is well-suited to dry, sunny conditions.
